title: Angela Aguilar, Gloria Estefan, Lenny TavÃ¡rez, Enrique Bunbury & More Celebrate Songwriting at LaÂ Musa
summary: The 12th annual edition of the Latin Songwriters Hall of Fame award was a heartfelt affair.
body: The 12th annual La Musa Awards, presented by the Latin Songwriters Hall of Fame, took place this year at the Flamingo Theater in Downtown Miami on Thursday (Oct. 16). The venueâ€™s intimacy, coupled with a more informal, speakeasy vibe, permeated an award ceremony that was notable for its moments of laughter and easy congeniality. It was also notable for its star power. Those in attendance included Gloria and Emilio Estefan, with Gloria presenting the La Musa Founders Award to Mike Oâ€™Neill, president and CEO of BMI and a major supporter of Latin music, who Gloria praised for his â€œgenuine heart and unwavering dedication.â€ Alex GonzÃ¡lez, drummer for Mexican rock band ManÃ¡, introduced new inductee Enrique Bunbury, the eclectic Spanish rocker. Angela Aguilar gave a heartfelt speech accepting the La Musa Elena Casals award, and Lenny TavÃ¡rez, the reggaetÃ³n star whoâ€™s written major hits for many different artists, confessed that just a year ago, heâ€™d sat in the audience yearning for an award. He accepted the La Musa Triunfador award from producer Sergio George. As La Musa cofounder Rudy PÃ©rez noted, George was one of three producers present that evening who made it onto the Top Producers â€¦

title: How Anyma Pulled Off the Biggest Electronic Music Show Ever at the Pyramids of Giza: â€˜TrulyÂ Historicâ€™
summary: The DJ's agent, CAA's Ferry Rais-Shaghaghi, says the goal was to use technology "to showcase the Pyramids, not overshadow them."
body: Roughly 4,625 years ago, Egyptian laborers constructed the Pyramids of Giza. The people who forged these sacred sites housing the tombs of pharaohs were visionary in their designs, but there’s no way they could have foreseen that thousands of years later, the place they created would host 15,000 people arriving to see a musical genre that wouldn’t be invented for millennia. This bridging of ancient history and cutting-edge future happened on Oct. 10, when Anyma performed what his team says was the biggest electronic music show to ever happen at the Pyramids, and possibly the biggest electronic music performance ever in Egypt. Related Inside the Creation of Anymaâ€™s Sphere Residency: â€˜This Was Something Else Entirelyâ€™ Inside the Creation of Anymaâ€™s Sphere Residency: â€˜This Was Something Else Entirelyâ€™ 'VIBE' Is Joining Forces With 'Rolling Stone' The night featured two performances from the Italian-American producer, who started making major waves in late 2024 when he launched his residency at Las Vegas’ Sphere. This Sphere run debuted his show The End of Genesys , which the artist, born Matteo Milleri, also performed at the Pyramids alâ€¦

title: No Doubt Is Playing Las Vegasâ€™ Sphere: Hereâ€™s How to ScoreÂ Tickets
summary: The band went on hiatus in the mid-2010s.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. You read that right. After almost a decade apart, No Doubt is back. The band is set to play 12 shows that will run in May at the Sphere in Las Vegas, visible from the glitzy Las Vegas Strip . First reported by TMZ , this stint will make singer Gwen Stefani the first woman to headline the 17,600-seat arena. Since opening in late 2023, the arena has hosted the likes of U2, Dead & Company, Eagles, Backstreet Boys and more. The news of the band’s reunion at the Sphere was posted to the venue’s Instagram on Oct. 10 along with the caption, “Remain seated, please. Permanecer sentados, por favor. Welcome to the Vegas skyline. ğŸŠğŸ‘‘ We are pleased to announce our limited engagement run, No Doubt Live @SphereVegas , May 2026.” View this post on Instagram A post shared by No Doubt (@nodoubt) If you’re pumped for the band’s reunion, you can shop tickets for their upcoming shows at the Sphere below. title: Wolvaardt 'close to her best' as South Africa beat Sri Lanka
summary: South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt puts on a batting display "close to her best" as her half-century leads the Proteas to a comfortable 10-wicket win over Sri Lanka in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup in Sri Lanka.

title: Daddy Yankeeâ€™s Faith-Based Album â€˜Lamento en Baileâ€™ & More Best New MusicÂ Latin
summary: Plus, check out Billboard's New Music Latin weekly playlist below!
body: New Music Latin  is a compilation of the best new Latin songs and albums recommended by  Billboard  and  Billboard EspaÃ±ol  editors. Check out this weekâ€™s picks below. Daddy Yankee, Lamento en Baile (DY Records/Zarpazo Records/HYBE Latin America) With 19 songs that fuse reggaetÃ³n with other Latin rhythms, DY presents  LAMENTO EN BAILE , his first album since his conversion to faith. The songs revolve around his relationship with God and his new place in the world after embracing faith. The lyrics, some inspired by proverbs and biblical passages, convey the fervor of his first love with God, without losing his personal touch. DY alternates between melodic singing and rap bars while the songs flow organically like a cohesive set curated by a DJ. The album also addresses social realities, as in â€œJARDÃN ROJOâ€: a poetic denunciation of gender violence that serves as a warning to those who suffer in silence. In â€œJEZABEL Y JUDAS,â€ DY deploys an intense metaphor about betrayal and evil in disguise, using those two infamous biblical figures. Other tracks are inspired by the Psalms, such as â€œTE ALABARÃ‰ (Sal 27)â€; the only collaboration is â€œABCDâ€ with Alex Zurdoâ€¦

title: The 14 Best Halloween Costumes for Pop CultureÂ Fanatics
summary: From Wednesday to Wicked, check out our list of the coolest pop culture Halloween costumes to buy right now.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Halloween is almost here. It’s time to start thinking about a costume before it’s too late. If you’re not going the DIY route, there are plenty of timely store-bought costume options to choose from that rely on cultural trends and products that just make sense. Do you want to be scary, funny or referential? Whatever you choose, we’ve got you covered. From superheroes to anime, movie characters, and more, ShopBillboard has compiled a list of 11 of the coolest pop culture Halloween costumes for 2025. If none of these are your vibe, hopefully it’ll get your creative juices flowing. And for more Halloween content, be sure to read our lists of the best musician-inspired Halloween costumes and spooky decorations . title: Sony Xperia 1 VIII surfaces for the first time
summary: Here are the model numbers for the Xperia 1 VIII.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR The Sony Xperia 1 VIII has been spotted in a database for eSIM-compatible phones. The model numbers are PM-1521-BV, PM-1522-BV, and PM-1523-BV. These model numbers are likely for the phone and its variants rather than three different models. There was a time when the fate of the Xperia line felt like it was up in the air, as it seemed the company was readying an exit from the mobile phone sector. However, Sonyâ€™s CFO confirmed that the firm still plans to support Xperia phones. Qualcomm also mentioned Sony as one of the manufacturers that will be taking advantage of its latest processor. As further proof that the Xperia line continues on, the companyâ€™s next Android flagship was recently spotted on a database. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Bruce Springsteenâ€™s Only Note on Jeremy Allen Whiteâ€™s â€˜Deliver Me From Nowhereâ€™ Portrayal: â€˜I Donâ€™t Remember Being That GoodÂ Lookingâ€™
summary: The rock icon said he was on set a lot, but he tried to stay out of the actor's way and just observe.
body: It must be super disconcerting to be on a movie set and watch a much younger man portray you during one of the most difficult periods of your life. It’s probably even harder to do if that man happens to be a pin-up worthy TV star. Just ask Bruce Springsteen , who sat down with his movie doppelganger, The Bear actor Jeremy Allen White, on The Graham Norton Show on Friday (Oct. 17) to discuss his feelings about the upcoming biopic Deliver Me From Nowhere , in which White plays The Boss at a pivotal point in his career. â€œI donâ€™t remember being that young or that good looking!,” Springsteen joked to Norton about what it felt like to watch White play him in the film that zooms in on the period in 1982 when the rocker was recording the spare Nebraska album, a left-turn LP that his label thought was potentially career suicide. Springsteen told Norton that the film is not a musical biopic in the vein of the Queen film Bohemian Rhapsody or the Elton John look back Rocketman . “[It’s] a character-driven drama with music,” Springsteen said, noting that he was on set “a lot” during the filming, but rarely gave White, 34, notes and just tried to enjoy â€¦

title: How Steve Martin & Alison Brown Accidentally Made a Star-Studded, Eclectic Bluegrass Album: â€˜It Was IncrediblyÂ Organicâ€™
summary: The Grammy-winning banjoists welcome fellow artists including Vince Gill, Indigo Girls, Jackson Browne and more on the new project.
body: Banjoists Alison Brown and Steve Martinâ€™s first collaborative album, Safe, Sensible and Sane, comes out today on Brownâ€™s Compass Records, but the pair never intended to make a full-fledged album â€” let alone a star-studded project. â€œIt was incredibly organic,â€ Brown said, seated backstage with Martin as the two prepared to co-host the International Bluegrass Music Association (IBMA) Awards last month in Chattanooga, Tennessee. â€œWe just kept writing songs, and then at one point we realized we had enough songs to put a bow around it to make a record.â€ The two had previously collaborated on â€œFoggy Morning Breaking,â€ an interpretive tribute to Earl Scruggsâ€™ classic, which was included on Brownâ€™s 2023 album On Banjo and spent 13 weeks at No. 1 on Bluegrass Today â€™s Grassicana chart. â€œIt was really just us communicating by text and working it out,â€ Martin recalled. â€œShe sent me this beautiful music, and asked, â€˜Can you write a few bars?â€™ So, I worked on that. We put the song out, and it went to No. 1. And that kind of made me feel like, â€˜Wow, a No. 1 bluegrass song,â€™ so then we wrote â€˜Bluegrass Radioâ€™ [featured on Safe, Sensible and Sane ], about a guy who is so happy that his song went â€¦

title: You can now preorder AYANEOâ€™s cheapest handheld yet, without the FOMO pricing
summary: The unbeatable super early bird pricing is here to stay.
body: Credit: AYANEO TL;DR The AYANEO Pocket AIR Mini is now available to pre-order on Indiegogo. The budget device starts at $69.99 and offers some GameCube and PS2 support. Super early bird pricing will be available for 30 days, and shipping starts at the end of November. AYANEO made big waves when it announced its first truly affordable device, the Pocket AIR Mini. It combines the companyâ€™s boutique design chops with a price thatâ€™s extremely competitive in the Android gaming handheld market, and starting today, you can finally buy one. Or at least, you can pre-order one. The Indiegogo campaign kicked off this morning, and as of writing, itâ€™s already racked up over $50,000 in orders. The device was a big seller when it launched in China last month, so expect that number to climb over the weekend and beyond.

title: A clever USB hack might just save QPR2 Beta 3 testers from their bootloops
summary: QPR2 Beta 3 testers are going to ridiculous lengths save their phones.
body: TL;DR Google has pulled Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 due to the risk of it bootlooping phones with desktop settings enabled. Users who already installed the update have been looking for solutions to escape the loop without a factory reset. A method involving plugging and unplugging USB peripherals has proved fruitful, but can be very slow to get results. Trying out beta software means accepting some level of risk, but how much do you really expect to break when running an Android beta? Maybe Google Wallet stops working? Fingerprint sensor shuts down? A few app crashes, sure, but most of the time Google still manages to give us a largely functional piece of software. That may be true, but this week was apparently the exception that proves the rule, as Google was forced to pump the brakes on Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 following reports of some seriously phone-breaking glitches. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Fairphone proves patience pays off with a surprise Android 15 jump
summary: Last yearâ€™s delay turns into an unexpected bonus for Fairphone 4 owners.
body: TL;DR The Fairphone 4 will skip Android 14 and jump straight to Android 15 in early November. According to the company, development sped up after last yearâ€™s Qualcomm-related delay. The update will roll out in batches, bringing the 2021 phone in line with its successors. Fairphone 4 owners have waited a long time for their next big software update, and in return for that patience, theyâ€™re getting more than they expected. The company has confirmed that itâ€™s skipping Android 14 entirely and going straight to Android 15 , with the rollout planned for early November. The announcement comes from a Fairphone employee on the companyâ€™s Community Forum , who said development has â€œsped upâ€ enough to make the jump possible. The update will roll out in batches, so donâ€™t worry if it doesnâ€™t appear on your phone right away.

title: HTC may be entering the gaming phone arena with a budget model
summary: HTC is cooking up some new Wildfire series phones.
body: Credit: Yasuhiro Yamane TL;DR A group of new HTC phones was spotted at the GITEX 2025 tech exhibition. The phones are new additions to the Wildfire series. One of the devices appears to be a budget gaming phone, which may be powered by a Unisoc T765 chip and a 5,600mAh battery. GITEX, a global tech exhibition, is taking place in Dubai this week. As you would expect, a variety of brands are at the event to showcase their wares. Even HTC is taking part in the action, and itâ€™s showing off several new Android phones in the Wildfire series. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Get a load of One UI 8.5â€™s flashy new lock screen media animation
summary: Whoosh!
body: TL;DR A new animation that plays when skipping tracks from the lock screen in Samsung One UI 8.5 has appeared on Twitter. One UI 8.5 is not officially released yet and this animation is subject to change. A beta program for One UI 8.5 is expected to begin in the coming weeks. Weâ€™ve seen a lot of One UI 8.5 in recent weeks, stemming from leaked builds that have made their way out ahead of an official beta reportedly starting before the end of the year . Early this morning, a splashy new lock screen media animation from an in-progress One UI 8.5 build surfaced on Twitter. A video shared by Tarun Vats on Twitter demonstrates the new effect on a phone running One UI 8.5. When tapping to skip forward or back, large album art fades from one album to the next, along with a sort of wipe effect that expands from one or two seemingly random spots within the frame.

title: Deal: Ember Smart Cup starts your day with a hot cup of joe, and keeps it hot!
summary: There's nothing worse than a cold sip of joe!
body: Credit: Ember It turns out many of our readers are morning people, so I am waking up earlier to write these deals. My morning coffee has never been as important as now, and if you can relate, have I got a deal for you! The Ember Cup (6oz) is just $49.98, which is a half-off sale! Buy the Ember Smart Cup 6oz for just $49.98 ($49.97 off)

title: This tiny clamshell might be your next EDC gaming handheld
summary: The miniature Game Boy Advance SP clone is launching this weekend.
body: TL;DR The Miyoo Mini Flip is a new clamshell gaming handheld with a tiny form factor. It has the same 2.8-inch screen as the Miyoo Mini, another very popular handheld. Orders start October 19 at 8 PM PT, although full pricing and specs are not yet available. The Game Boy Advance SP was the original clamshell EDC, and countless gaming handhelds have been chasing that high ever since. Earlier this year, the Miyoo Flip tried and mostly failed due to a seriously compromised hinge design. Now the company is back with an even smaller version, and hopefully itâ€™s learned from the previous release. The Miyoo Mini Flip has the same 2.8-inch screen as 2021â€™s Miyoo Mini, but apart from that, the company hasnâ€™t announced specs or pricing. Itâ€™s almost certainly going to be a low-powered Linux device, most likely topping off at PS1 emulation.

title: Usyk targeting 2026 return but rules out Itauma
summary: Oleksandr Usyk is targeting a return to the ring in 2026, but has ruled out a bout with British heavyweight Moses Itauma.

title: This denim-clad Android flagship is jean-ius
summary: It's giving "Casual Friday."
body: Credit: Redmi on Weibo TL;DR Redmi is teasing its upcoming K90 Pro Max flagship smartphone, featuring a unique â€œdenim-likeâ€ nano-leather textured back panel that is resistant to dirt and UV damage. Official renders also show Bose-branded speaker-like grilles on the back. Itâ€™s unclear if these are functional or decorative. Most Android flagships look and feel the same these days, and unless youâ€™re dabbling with foldables, it might be hard to get excited. However, occasionally, some OEMs experiment with the CMF of their phones, giving us some radically different smartphones that stand out from the crowd. The upcoming Redmi K90 Pro Max is one of those radically different phones that not only adopts a denim-like texture, but could also seemingly pack a rear-firing, Bose-tuned speaker. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

According to the report, Samsung has canceled its upcoming Galaxy S26 Edge and will release the Galaxy S26 Plus instead. The Edge was supposed to replace the Plus in next yearâ€™s Galaxy S family, but those plans are now apparently scrapped. The report cites extremely low sales of the Galaxy S25 Edge as the reason for the S26 Edgeâ€™s cancellation. However, there is one thing that bothers me about it. One thing Iâ€™d like Google to change with the Pixel 10a , and itâ€™s not what you think. title: Gemini can basically use Google Sheets for you now

body: TL;DR Gemini can now do more intricate work inside Google Sheets. You can now request complex, multi-stage edits in a single prompt. Last month, Google Sheets picked up additional Gemini functionality , gaining the ability call on Googleâ€™s AI to do things like explain how formulas work and automatically correct errors in formatting. title: Poll: Was Samsung right to cancel the Galaxy S26 Edge?
summary: Is five months enough time to judge the success of a new flagship phone line?
body: Samsung took a swing at the thin-and-light smartphones category with the Galaxy S25 Edge , releasing the phone before Apple could release the iPhone Air . Shockingly, mere five months after its launch, reports suggest that Samsung has killed the Edge line . That means no further production of the Galaxy S25 Edge beyond existing stock, and no plans to launch its successor, the Galaxy S26 Edge. One can argue that five months is too short a period to judge the performance of a phone line. So, was Samsung right to cancel the Galaxy S26 Edge? Reports suggest that the Galaxy S25 Edge sold only 1.31 million units since its launch in May, up to August. The first three months after launch are where most smartphone sales are concentrated, so this was seemingly enough of a runway for Samsung to assess the S25 Edgeâ€™s sales performance. In contrast, the Galaxy S25, S25 Plus, and S25 Ultra sold 8.28 million, 5.05 million, and 12.18 million units, respectively, as of August. Even the lowest-selling S25 Plus sold many times more than the Edge, but with the advantage of having launched earlier in the year.

The video, which aimed to create a custom OS for Arun Maini, breaks down every stage of the process, from planning to deployment, and reveals that developing a fully functional mobile OS would cost an eye-watering $40.47 million. body: TL;DR Google is updating the Android Easter egg in Android 16 QPR2 to properly showcase the new Live Updates feature. Live Updates allow apps to provide persistent progress updates in the status bar, on the always-on display, and at the top of the notification panel. The feature wasnâ€™t fully ready in Android 16â€™s initial release, which is why the Easter egg is only now being updated to support it. One of the biggest new features in Android 16 is Live Updates. Live Updates are basically Androidâ€™s version of iOSâ€™ Live Activities, and they allow you to quickly get progress updates from applications without stopping whatever youâ€™re doing. For example, a navigation app could use Live Updates to show your next turn in a status bar chip, or a food delivery app could use it to tell you that your food is about to be dropped off. Thereâ€™s a lot of potential ways that apps can use the Live Updates feature, but unfortunately, developers had to wait a bit to actually use it. Thatâ€™s because the Live Updates feature wasnâ€™t ready until last monthâ€™s Android 16 QPR1 release , which added full support for it. title: Nothing blames Apple patents for the lack of more phones with magnets for wireless charging
summary: Patents and red tape make for a lousy wireless charging landscape.
body: TL;DR Very few Android phones feature built-in magnets for wireless charging, while many more require a case with magnets. According to Nothing, patent restrictions prevent Android manufacturers from making phones optimally compatible with MagSafe. A company trying to develop its own compatible magnetic system could expect to invest $10M or more. Years and years after smartphones first started supporting it, wireless charging is having a moment. And itâ€™s all Appleâ€™s Qi2â€™s fault. At least, while weâ€™ve been able to drop phones on charging mats for ages, the convenience and efficiency of magnet-aligned wireless charging has only really taken off with the introduction of MagSafe accessories â€” and now with the arrival of Qi2 25W, Android devices are finally starting to get in on the action. title: Octoberâ€™s Night Sky Notes: Letâ€™s Go, LIGO!
summary: by Kat Troche of the Astronomical Society of the Pacific September 2025 marks ten years since the first direct detection of gravitational waves as predicted by Albert Einsteinâ€™s 1916 theory of General Relativity. These invisible ripples in space were first directly detected by the Laser Interferomeâ€¦
body: 4 Min Read Octoberâ€™s Night Sky Notes: Letâ€™s Go, LIGO! An artistâ€™s impression of gravitational waves generated by binary neutron stars. Credits: R. Hurt/Caltech-JPL by Kat Troche of the Astronomical Society of the Pacific September 2025 marks ten years since the first direct detection of gravitational waves as predicted by Albert Einsteinâ€™s 1916 theory of General Relativity. These invisible ripples in space were first directly detected by the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO). Traveling at the speed of light (~186,000 miles per second), these waves stretch and squeeze the fabric of space itself, changing the distance between objects as they pass. Waves In Space Gravitational waves are created when massive objects accelerate in space, especially in violent events. LIGO detected the first gravitational waves when two black holes, orbiting one another, finally merged, creating ripples in space-time. But these waves are not exclusive to black holes . If a star were to go supernova, it could produce the same effect. Neutron stars can also create these waves for various reasons. While these waves are invisible to the human eye, this animation from NASAâ€™s Science â€¦

title: NASA, Blue Origin Invite Media to Attend Mars Mission Launch
summary: NASA and Blue Origin are reopening media accreditation for the launch of the agencyâ€™s ESCAPADE (Escape and Plasma Acceleration and Dynamics Explorers) mission. The twin ESCAPADE spacecraft will study the solar windâ€™s interaction with Mars, providing insight into the planetâ€™s real-time response to sâ€¦
body: A stylized illustration shows the twin ESCAPADE spacecraft entering Marsâ€™ orbit. Credits: James Rattray/Rocket Lab USA NASA and Blue Origin are reopening media accreditation for the launch of the agencyâ€™s ESCAPADE (Escape and Plasma Acceleration and Dynamics Explorers) mission. The twin ESCAPADE spacecraft will study the solar windâ€™s interaction with Mars, providing insight into the planetâ€™s real-time response to space weather and how solar activity drives atmospheric escape. This will be the second launch of Blue Originâ€™s New Glenn rocket. Media interested in covering ESCAPADE launch activities must apply for media credentials. Media who previously applied for media credentials for the ESCAPADE launch do not need to reapply. U.S. media and U.S. citizens representing international media must apply by 11:59 p.m. EDT on Monday, Oct. 13. Media accreditation requests should be submitted online to: https://media.ksc.nasa.gov . A copy of NASAâ€™s media accreditation policy is available online. For questions about accreditation, please email: ksc-media-accreditat@mail.nasa.gov . For other mission questions, please contact NASA Kennedyâ€™s newsroom: 321-867-2468. Blue Origin is targâ€¦

body: Skywatching Skywatching Home Whatâ€™s Up Meteor Showers Eclipses Daily Moon Guide More Tips & Guides Skywatching FAQ Night Sky Network A supermoon, and meteor showers from the Draconids and Orionids A supermoon takes over the sky, the Draconid meteor shower peeks through, and the Orionid meteor shower shines bright. Skywatching Highlights Oct. 6: The October supermoon Oct. 6-10: The Draconid meteor shower Oct. 21: The Orionid meteor shower peaks (full duration Sept. 26 â€“ Nov. 22) Transcript Whatâ€™s Up for October? A Supermoon takes over, the Draconid meteor shower peeks through, and the Orionid meteors sparkle across the night sky. The evening of October 6, look up and be amazed as the full moon is bigger and brighter because â€“ itâ€™s a supermoon! Illustrated infographic showing the difference (as seen from Earth) between perigee, when a supermoon appears, and apogee, when a micromoon appears. NASA/JPL-Caltech This evening, the moon could appear to be about 30% brighter and up to 14% larger than a typical full moon. But why? Supermoons happen when a new moon or a full moon coincides with â€œperigee,â€ which is when the moon is at its closest to Earth all month. So this is an exceptioâ€¦

title: Helio Highlights: October 2025
summary: Since we all have a relationship with the Sun, it is important to learn about how it impacts our lives. NASAâ€™s Heliophysics Education Activation Team (HEAT) teaches people of all ages about the Sun, covering everything from how to safely view an eclipse to how to mitigate the effects of geomagneticâ€¦
body: Explore This Section Science Science Activation Helio Highlights: Octoberâ€¦ Home Framework for Heliophysics Education About Helio Big Idea 1.1 Helio Big Idea 1.2 Helio Big Idea 1.3 Helio Big Idea 2.1 Helio Big Idea 2.2 Helio Big Idea 2.3 Helio Big Idea 3.1 Helio Big Idea 3.2 Helio Big Idea 3.3 Helio Missions Helio Topics Resource Database About NASA HEAT More Highlights Space Math 5 min read Helio Highlights: October 2025 5 Min Read Helio Highlights: October 2025 NASA Education Specialist Christine Milotte demonstrates heliophysics activities during a teacher professional development event hosted by the NASA Heliophysics Education Activation Team (HEAT) at the Dallas Arboretum, Saturday, April 6, 2024. Credits: NASA/Keegan Barber The Sun and Our Lives On a clear night, you might see thousands of stars in the sky. Most of these stars are dozens or hundreds of light years away from us. A light year is the distance a beam of light travels in a year: about 5.88 trillion miles (9.46 trillion kilometers). This means that for those stars we see at night, it takes their light, which travels at about 186,000 miles per second (or about 300 thousand kilometers per second), dozens or hundreds â€¦

title: Discovery Alert: â€˜Babyâ€™ Planet Photographed in a Ring around a Star for the First Time!
summary: The (Proto) Planet: WISPIT 2b The Discovery: Researchers have discovered a young protoplanet called WISPIT 2b embedded in a ring-shaped gap in a disk encircling a young star. While theorists have thought that planets likely exist in these gaps (and possibly even create them), this is the first timeâ€¦
body: This artistâ€™s concept depicts the protoplanet WISPIT 2b accreting matter as it orbits around its star, WISPIT 2. NASA/JPL-Caltech/R. Hurt (IPAC) The (Proto) Planet: WISPIT 2b The Discovery: Researchers have discovered a young protoplanet called WISPIT 2b embedded in a ring-shaped gap in a disk encircling a young star. While theorists have thought that planets likely exist in these gaps (and possibly even create them), this is the first time that it has actually been observed. This image of the WISPIT 2 system was captured by the Magellan Telescope in Chile and the Large Binocular Telescope in Arizona. The protoplanet WISPIT 2b is a small purple dot to the right of a bright white ring of dust surrounding the systemâ€™s star. A fainter white ring outside of WISPIT 2b can be seen. Laird Close, University of Arizona Key Takeaway: Researchers have directly detected â€“ essentially photographed â€“ a new planet called WISPIT 2b, labeled a protoplanet because it is an astronomical object that is accumulating material and growing into a fully-realized planet. However, even in its â€œprotoâ€ state, WISPIT 2b is a gas giant about 5 times as massive as Jupiter. This massive protoplanet is just about â€¦

title: Jupiterâ€™s Volcanic Moon Io
summary: During its close flyby of Jupiterâ€™s moon Io on December 30, 2023, NASAâ€™s Juno spacecraft captured some of the most detailed imagery ever of Ioâ€™s volcanic surface. In this image, taken by the JunoCam instrument from about 930 miles (1,500 kilometers) above the moon, Ioâ€™s night side [left lobe] is ilâ€¦
body: NASA/Jet Propulsion Laboratoryâ€“Caltech/Southwest Research Institute (SwRI)/Malin Space Science Systems (MSSS); Image processing: Emma WÃ¤limÃ¤ki Â© CC BY During its close flyby of Jupiterâ€™s moon Io on December 30, 2023, NASAâ€™s Juno spacecraft captured some of the most detailed imagery ever of Ioâ€™s volcanic surface. In this image, taken by the JunoCam instrument from about 930 miles (1,500 kilometers) above the moon, Ioâ€™s night side [left lobe] is illuminated by â€œJupitershine,â€ which is sunlight reflected from the planetâ€™s surface. This image is the NASA Science Image of the Month for October 2025 . Each month, NASAâ€™s Science Mission Directorate chooses an image to feature, offering desktop wallpaper downloads, as well as links to related topics, activities, and games.
